cancer_indication: HR+/HER2-negative, PIK3CA-mutated advanced or metastatic breast cancer (post-endocrine therapy)
moa: Alpelisib selectively inhibits the PI3K–AKT–mTOR signaling pathway by targeting the p110α (PIK3CA) subunit, blocking PIP3 production and preventing AKT activation, which leads to cell cycle arrest and apoptosis in PIK3CA-mutant breast cancer【7 L208-L217】. In ER² (luminal) tumors, PI3Kα inhibition causes upregulation of estrogen receptor signaling; thus, combining alpelisib with an ER antagonist (fulvestrant) yields synergistic anti-tumor effects【7 L229-L237】. Overall, alpelisib selectively shuts down the PI3K–AKT growth pathway in PI3K-addicted cancer cells, exploiting a synthetic lethality with ER blockade in HR+/PIK3CA-mutant breast cancer【7 L208-L217】【7 L229-L237】.
pathway_sets_description: PI3K–AKT–mTOR signaling: regulates cell growth and survival via AKT and mTOR【10 L407-L415】.
Estrogen receptor signaling: drives hormone-mediated proliferation in ER-positive tumors【10 L421-L430】.
RTK/RAS–MAPK cascade: transduces growth factor signals through RAS/RAF/MEK/ERK【11 L438-L447】.
Cell cycle regulation: controls G1→S transition via Cyclin D–CDK4/6 and E2F【11 L507-L516】.
Insulin signaling: transduces insulin effects on metabolism and cell growth via PI3K–AKT【11 L523-L531】.
pathway_sets_interpretations: Central oncogenic pathway; its inhibition by alpelisib underlies sensitivity in PIK3CA-mutant tumors【10 L412-L419】.
Critical HR+ pathway; PI3Kα blockade triggers compensatory ER activation (a sensitivity factor for endocrine combination)【10 L423-L430】.
Alternate proliferation pathway; activation of RTK/RAS–MAPK confers resistance when PI3Kα is inhibited【11 L441-L450】.
Drives proliferation; suppression (G1 arrest) correlates with response, while Cyclin E/RB1 alterations confer resistance【11 L507-L516】.
Mediates metabolic signals; PI3Kα inhibition causes insulin feedback, altering tumor metabolism and potentially affecting drug response【11 L523-L531】.
sensitivity_genes_up_interpretations: Activating PIK3CA mutations create dependence on PI3Kα signaling, so their presence predicts sensitivity to alpelisib【15 L890-L899】.
resistance_genes_up_interpretations: ESR1 mutations (constitutive ER activity) can drive resistance by bypassing PI3Kα dependence【19 L1125-L1134】.
AKT1 mutations (e.g. E17K) activate downstream PI3K–AKT signaling independent of PI3Kα【19 L1159-L1166】.
PIK3CG (p110γ) upregulation sustains PI3K–AKT signaling via an alternate isoform【19 L1163-L1166】.
KRAS mutations activate the MAPK pathway, providing an alternative growth drive when PI3Kα is inhibited【19 L1167-L1173】.
ERBB3 (HER3) overexpression increases RTK signaling, reactivating PI3K/MAPK pathways despite alpelisib【20 L1231-L1239】.
IGF1R overexpression similarly reactivates PI3K/MAPK signaling downstream of receptor feedback【20 L1231-L1239】.
CDK2 overexpression drives cell cycle progression (G1/S) independent of PI3Kα, leading to resistance【20 L1245-L1253】.
CCNE1 (Cyclin E1) overexpression sustains G1/S transition, bypassing PI3Kα-driven growth control【20 L1245-L1253】.
resistance_genes_down_interpretations: PTEN loss removes negative regulation of PI3K, activating PI3Kβ/AKT and conferring resistance【19 L1101-L1110】.
RB1 loss bypasses G1 arrest and allows proliferation without PI3Kα signaling【20 L1245-L1253】.
pathways_upregulated_interpretations: ER pathway feedback is activated in ER+ tumors after PI3Kα inhibition, reflecting compensatory upregulation【22 L576-L584】.
HER2/HER3–MAPK signaling rises in resistant tumors due to relieved feedback, driving alternative proliferation【22 L619-L627】.
Inflammatory JAK/STAT (SRC–STAT3) signaling is elevated in resistant models (often with PTEN loss), aiding survival【22 L637-L646】.
Alternate AKT activation emerges (via mTORC2 or PI3Kβ) in resistance, restoring PI3K–AKT signaling despite PI3Kα inhibition【22 L653-L661】.
Glycolytic metabolism is upregulated systemically due to insulin feedback from PI3Kα blockade, which can fuel tumor metabolism【22 L669-L677】.
Intrinsic apoptotic pathways become active in responders undergoing cell death, reflecting successful tumor kill【22 L686-L690】.
pathways_downregulated_interpretations: PI3K–AKT pathway activity is markedly reduced in responders (p-AKT and mTOR activity down), and its suppression is a hallmark of effective alpelisib therapy【24 L750-L758】.
Cell cycle progression programs (E2F targets) are suppressed, leading to G1 arrest and reduced proliferation in sensitive tumors【24 L766-L774】.
Anti-apoptotic signaling (e.g. NF-κB) is diminished, tilting balance toward apoptosis in tumors that respond to alpelisib【24 L782-L790】.
mTORC1-driven protein synthesis is inhibited (reduced S6/4EBP1 phosphorylation), contributing to growth arrest【24 L798-L807】.
Some DNA repair gene sets (e.g. homologous recombination) are downregulated, increasing DNA damage in treated cells【24 L812-L821】.
contraindications: History of severe hypersensitivity to alpelisib
notes: Most clinical evidence is in HR+/HER2–, PIK3CA-mutant breast cancer; roles in HER2+ or TNBC are still being explored【7 L252-L259】.
